dublinCore.dc:title: 113 S1807 IS: Corn Ethanol Mandate Elimination Act of 2013
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mrs. Feinstein (for herself, Mr. Coburn, Mrs. Hagan, Ms. Collins, Mr. Toomey, Mr. Flake, Mr. Corker, Mr. Burr, Mr. Risch, and Mr. Manchin) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Environment and Public Works

form.official-title: To amend the Clean Air Act to eliminate the corn ethanol mandate for renewable fuel, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Corn Ethanol Mandate Elimination Act of 2013.

section.header: Elimination of corn ethanol mandate for renewable fuel

subsection.text: Section 211(o)(2)(B)(i) of the Clean Air Act (42 U.S.C. 7545(o)(2)(B)(i)) is amended by striking subclause (I).
Section 211(o)(2)(B) of the Clean Air Act (42 U.S.C. 7545(o)(2)(B)) is amended—

subparagraph.text: by redesignating subclauses (II) through (IV) as subclauses (I) through (III), respectively;
in subclause (I) (as so redesignated), by striking of the volume of renewable fuel required under subclause (I),; and
in subclauses (II) and (III) (as so redesignated), by striking subclause (II) each place it appears and inserting subclause (I); and

paragraph.text: in clause (v), by striking clause (i)(IV) and inserting clause (i)(III).

subsection.text: Nothing in this section or the amendments made by this section affects the volumes of advanced biofuel, cellulosic biofuel, or biomass-based diesel that are required under section 211(o) of the Clean Air Act (42 U.S.C. 7545(o)).

Not later than 180 days after the date of enactment of this Act, the Administrator of the Environmental Protection Agency shall promulgate such regulations as are necessary to carry out the amendments made by this section.
The amendments made by this section shall take effect on the date that is 180 days after the date of enactment of this Act.
